Molecular Programming Project
2016 Annual Workshop

January 15-18, 2016

Seattle, WA

Venue

  • Questions: Contact Lindsay Aplesand at lappesla -- at -- uw -- dot -- edu.
  • Airport: SEA-TAC
  • Hotels: We have reserved blocks at the following three hotels. Tell them you want a room in the "MPP" room block when you reserve your room. If that does not work, reference "UW Electrical Engineering Conference". They are all walking distance from Kane Hall, with the Silver Cloud being the longest (and steepest!) walk.
    • The Watertown
    • The University Inn
    • The Silver Cloud
  • University of Washington: Directions
    • Talks and posters in the Walker Ames Room in Kane Hall
    • Sunday night dinner at the UW Club
  • Friday reception: at the Living Computer Museum, transportation not provided! See below.

Schedule

Friday January 15, 2016

7:00PM Reception (appetizers, desserts, and drinks) At the Living Computer Museum. Note: The museum is here. It is not near the UW campus or your hotel! Unfortunately, we cannot provide transportation to and from the museum. We recommend you take a cab or Uber from the UW campus (20-30 minutes depending on traffic) or from the airport (15-20 minutes).

Saturday January 16, 2016 (Walker Ames Room at UW)

8:00AM Registration / Coffee (Note: no breakfast)
8:50AM Eric Klavins Welcome and Overview
9:00AM Rebecca Schulman Invited Talk
9:40AM Siddharth Jain Duplication Correcting Codes for DNA Storage
10:00AM Nandhini Ponnuswamy Oligolysine protects DNA nanostructures from in vivo threats
10:20AM Coffee Break
10:40AM Carlos Castro Invited Talk: Programming DNA origami dynamics
11:20AM Harry Choi Molecular Instruments
11:40AM David Younger Expanding Synthetic Cell-Cell Communication: Inspiration from the Immune System
12:00PM Lunch Catered
1:20PM James Carothers Invited Talk
2:00PM Chris Thachuk Fast and leakless DNA strand displacement cascades
2:20PM Parsa Nafisi Toward Scalable Production of Highly Custom Single-Stranded DNA
2:40PM Coffee Break
3:00PM Anu Thubagere Compiler-aided systematic construction of large-scale DNA strand displacement circuits using unpurified components
3:20PM Kevin Cherry Scaling up molecular pattern recognition with DNA-based winner-take-all neural networks
3:40PM Poster presenters A-L Lightning Talks I : One minute each!
4:00PM Poster presenters A-L Poster Session I (Kane Hall, 2nd floor)
Evening Dinner on your own

Sunday January 17, 2016 (Walker Ames Room at UW)

8:30AM Coffee (Note: no breakfast)
9:00AM David Baker Invited Talk
9:40AM Erik Winfree Domain-level and sequence-level simulation of interacting DNA molecules
10:00AM Miles Gander Robust digital logic circuits in eukaryotic cells with CRISPR/dCas9 NOR gates
10:20AM Coffee Break
10:40AM Thomas Ouldridge Invited Talk: Information and thermodynamics in biochemical networks
11:20AM William Shih DNA origami capsules for future therapeutics
11:40AM Jongmin Kim Ribocomputers for in vivo logic computation
12:00PM Lunch Catered
1:20PM David Soloveichik Invited Talk
2:00PM Ashwin Gopinath TBA
2:20PM Alex Rosenberg TBA
2:40PM Coffee Break
3:00PM William Shih, Lulu Qian, and Eric Klavins Panel on Education in Molecular Programming
3:40PM Poster presenters M-Z Lightning Talks II : One minute each!
4:00PM Poster presenters M-Z Poster Session II (Kane Hall, 2nd floor)
6:00PM Dinner at the UW Club

Monday January 18, 2016 (Walker Ames Room)

8:30AM Coffee (Note: no breakfast)
9:00AM Julius Lucks Invited Talk
9:40AM Ben Groves Rewiring MAP kinases in yeast to regulate novel targets
10:00AM Farzad Farnoud Stochastic Models for DNA Tandem Duplication
10:20AM Coffee Break
10:40AM Domitilla Del Vecchio Invited Talk
11:20AM Jie Shen Nanolithography with DNA Brick Crystals
11:40AM Richard Murray Rapid cell-free forward engineering of novel genetic ring oscillators
12:00PM Adjourn
